chronic nasal obstruction secondary to deviated nasal septum and inferior turbinate hypertrophy.

chronic nasal obstruction secondary to deviated nasal septum and inferior turbinate hypertrophy.
blood loss: minimal less than 25 cc.
the patient is a 51-year-old female with a history of chronic nasal obstruction.

on physical examination, she was derived to have a severely deviated septum with an s-shape deformity as well as turbinate hypertrophy present along the inferior turbinates contributing to the obstruction.

on physical examination, she was derived to have a severely deviated septum with an s-shape deformity as well as turbinate hypertrophy present along the inferior turbinates contributing to the obstruction.

on physical examination, she was derived to have a severely deviated septum with an s-shape deformity as well as turbinate hypertrophy present along the inferior turbinates contributing to the obstruction.
nasal pledgets saturated with 4 cc of 10% cocaine solution were inserted into the nasal cavities.
the nasal septum as well as the turbinates were localized with the mixture of 1% lidocaine with 1:100000 epinephrine solution.
the turbinates as well as an infraorbital nerve block was performed with 0.25% marcaine solution.
the nasal vestibules were then cleansed with a phisohex solution.
finally, merocel packing was placed and the patient was retuned to the department of anesthesia for awakening and taken to the recovery room without incident.
